For an ellipse. A must be positive definite. A = I gives the circle x2 + )'2 = 1. If an 
eigenvalue is negative (exchange 4's and 5's in A ). we oon't have an ellipse. The sum 
of squares becomes a diffaence of squares: 9X 2 _ y2 = I. This is a hyperbola. For a 
negative definite matrix like A = -I. the graph of _xl_ y2 = I has no points al all. 
• REVIEW OF THE KEY IDEAS • 
I. Positive definite matrices have positive eigenvalues and positive pi~ots.
